propertyInfo.body: This property is attracting a lot of interest and is no longer available. Another investor has positioned himself on it. Watch out for the next alert to get priority on the next nugget.
propertyInfo.investStrategyModal: This property is ideal if you are aiming for a dynamic investment strategy. Why? Because it is self-financing. Because it is self-financing: the rents it generates are higher than the costs (loan, charges and taxes). It has a riskier profile than an asset-based investment, but it is also more profitable.

financialTool.annualPercentEvolution: Annual evolution of the price of the property
financialTool.annualPercentEvolutionDescription: Average annual evolution of the land in the last years: {{evolution}}
financialTool.bankCapitalStillDue: Outstanding capital due to the bank
financialTool.cumulativeCashFlow: Cumulative cash flow (or Cumulative savings effort)
financialTool.enrichmentResellingYearNegative:
Net profit generated by the project after {{year}} years.
 Formula: resale price - outstanding capital - contribution - cumulative savings efforts
financialTool.enrichmentResellingYearPositive:
Net profit generated by the project after {{year}} years.
 Formula: resale price - outstanding capital - contribution + cumulative cash surpluses
financialTool.evaluationRateUnavaible: The transaction history available in this area is not sufficient to give an accurate account of the evolution of property prices.
financialTool.flagEnrichment_lokimo1: *Property prices have risen by an average of {{avgLast5Years}} per year in {{dataLevel}} over the last 5 years. This value is not a prediction of future developments but gives a trend for the area.
financialTool.lokimo:
*Average annual increase in land value in the area 
Source: Lokimo - 5 year forecast
financialTool.lokimo1: *5-year valuation of land in the area. (Source: Lokimo).
financialTool.monthlyCashflow: This means a monthly cash surplus
financialTool.projectCashFlow: Self-financing project from {{loanDownValue}} contribution over {{loanDurationValue}} years
financialTool.resellingYearCashFlow: Cash available in the year of resale

tooltip.annualChargesDescription: Charges recoverable from the tenant. They are paid by the tenant at the same time as the rent.
tooltip.annualHomeOwnerInsuranceDescription: Non-occupational landlord insurance. This insurance provides the owner with all the guarantees to cover both the dwelling and any damage that may be caused to the tenants.
tooltip.annualPercentEvolution:
The property price has increased on average by {{ evaluationRate }} per year in the area over the last 5 years.
Project different scenarios by changing the assumption of the market price evolution.
tooltip.annualPropertyManagementDescription: Leasing costs (10â‚¬ per m2 rented) and current management costs (4.99% of rent collected).
tooltip.annualTurnoverIndiceDescription: Number of months the property will be occupied. Masteos takes a conservative occupancy assumption for the calculation of the annual income.
tooltip.bankCapitalStillDue: The amount to be repaid to the bank in the year of the resale of the property when the property is sold before the maturity date of the loan. This amount is known in advance as it is included in the loan amortization table provided by the bank.
tooltip.bankCommissionDescription: Application fee charged by the bank (800â‚¬) and mortgage guarantee fee (1% of the capital borrowed)
tooltip.cashflowResellingYear:
The amount available to the investor in the year of resale of the property, after repayment of the bank, if the resale takes place before the maturity date of the loan.
Formula: Resale price - outstanding capital
tooltip.cumulativeCashFlowNegative:
Cumulative savings effort throughout the period of ownership of the property.
Formula: saving effort year 1 + saving effort year 2 + ... + saving effort year X
tooltip.cumulativeCashFlowPositive:
Cumulative excess cash flow over the period of ownership of the property.
Formula: cash surplus year 1 + cash surplus year 2 + ... + cash surplus year X
tooltip.enrichmentResellingYearNegative:
Net profit generated by the project after {{year}} years.
Formula: resale price - outstanding capital - contribution - cumulative savings efforts
tooltip.enrichmentResellingYearPositive:
Net profit generated by the project after {{year}} years.
Formula: resale price - outstanding capital - contribution + cumulative cash surpluses
tooltip.evaluationRateUnavaible: The transaction history available in this area is not sufficient to give an accurate account of the evolution of property prices.
tooltip.flagEnrichment_annualTurnoverIndiceDescr: Annual occupancy rate of the property expressed in number of months. The rental vacancy on this project represents a loss of income of â‚¬{{amount}}.
tooltip.grossReturnDescription:
Allows to measure the gross profitability of the investment.
Formula : ( Monthly rent including charges * 12 ) / ( Selling price FAI + Works + Furnishing )
tooltip.investCapitalMultiplier:
Net wealth expressed as a multiple of capital invested.
Formula: ( Net wealth + capital invested ) / capital invested
tooltip.loanDownDescription: The amount paid by the investor to finance the part of the acquisition not covered by the loan. Banks require a deposit of 10-15% of the project cost.
tooltip.loanDownResellingDescription: The amount paid by the investor to finance the part of the acquisition not covered by the loan. Banks require a deposit of 10-15% of the project cost.
tooltip.masteosCommission: Fees for sourcing and transactional follow-up services. These are degressive depending on the price of the property.
tooltip.monthlyCashflowDescription:
- If positive :
Excess cash flow contributing to project enrichment
- If negative :
Amount that the investor will have to pay to cover expenses not covered by the rents
tooltip.netReturnDescription:
Allows you to measure the profitability net of charges.
Formula: ( Monthly rent including charges - annual charges ) / ( Selling price FAI + Works + Furnishing )
tooltip.projectAmountDescription: Formula : Sale price FAI + Works + Furnishing + Notary fees + Masteos fees + Bank fees + Brokerage fees
tooltip.rentalVacationDescription: Cost of vacancy (the period between two lettings during which the property does not generate income). For this project, we estimate that the vacancy will be {{value}} months per year
tooltip.resellingPrice: Resale price of the property projected over {{resellingYear}} years at an annual rate of change in land prices of {{evaluationRate}} %
tooltip.resellingYearCashFlow:
The amount available to the investor in the year of resale of the property, after repayment of the bank, if the resale takes place before the maturity date of the loan.
 Formula: Resale price - outstanding capital
tooltip.resellingYearDescription: Number of years the property was held until it was resold.
tooltip.salePrice: The sale price includes the agency fees. It includes the price negotiated with the seller plus the fees of the agency representing the seller.
tooltip.totalLoanAmountDescription:
Capital borrowed to finance the acquisition.
Formula: Project cost - Contribution.

DPE.aDescription: Very energy-efficient property: it does not require thermal renovation until 2050.
DPE.bDescription: Energy efficient: no thermal renovation is required before 2050.
DPE.cDescription: Relatively energy-efficient property: no need for thermal renovation until 2050.
DPE.caption: Unit of measurement expressed in kWhEP/mÂ².an
DPE.dDescription: Moderately energy efficient property. It is likely to require thermal renovation in the future: insulation (walls, attic, floors, roofs, skylights, etc.) or replacement of the boiler.
DPE.eDescription: In January 2034 these properties will be prohibited from being rented out. Thermal renovation works (e.g. improvement of insulation and/or replacement of the heating system) will be necessary to continue renting the property until then.
DPE.fDescription: In January 2028 these properties will be forbidden to be rented. Thermal renovation works (e.g. improvement of insulation and/or replacement of the heating system) are included in the renovation budget in order to allow the property to be rented legally.
DPE.gDescription: In January 2023 G-rated properties with oil and gas heating will be banned from letting. Then in January 2025 all G-rated properties will no longer be rentable. Thermal renovation works are included in the renovation budget to allow the property to be rented legally.
DPE.title: Energy consumption

GES.aDescription: A property that emits very little greenhouse gases. It uses renewable energy and/or has good insulation.
GES.bDescription: A property with low greenhouse gas emissions. It uses renewable energy and/or has good insulation.
GES.cDescription: Property that has standard environmental performance. It has a reasonable ecological impact that can be improved: thermal renovation and/or switch to renewable energy.
GES.caption: Unit of measurement expressed in kgeqCO2/mÂ².year
GES.dDescription: Rather polluting. It requires renovations to limit the carbon impact of the house.
GES.eDescription: It is a polluting and old building. It requires major renovations to limit the carbon impact of the house.
GES.fDescription: A very polluting property of old construction. It requires major renovations to limit the carbon impact of the house.
GES.gDescription: Extremely polluting property of old construction. It requires major renovations to limit the carbon impact of the house.
GES.title: Greenhouse gas emissions
